author: Jos Poortvliet
message:
Comparing Gnome Shell with Plasma?!? Why would you do that? You could probably easily write Gnome Shell in Plasma, but Gnome Shell is nowhere comparable in terms of technology and flexibility. Of course these aren't it's goals, it's just supposed to be a new, innovative (but static) desktop replacement.

The ideas in Gnome Shell are pretty good and interesting, and it's implementation is more interesting than the current Plasma desktop.

Which makes sense, as the Gnome Shell ppl simply started with a relatively concrete idea for a desktop shell and started to implement it, while Plasma is meant to be a platform for writing desktop shells, and currently only a legacy desktop paradigm is implemented in Plasma. IOW Gnome Shell should probably have been written in Plasma ;-)

replies.author: Aurélien
replies.message: We were in fact discussing the public reactions to both products, not the technical details. And as I said, we were tired :)
